title: Newly Saved Item Sets Aren't Showing up in Legacy Client
body: I just bought Rammus{{champion:33}} a day or two ago and made a bunch of item sets for him today, but when I went in game they didn't show up. This has been a common bug in the past, where item sets just don't save properly, so I payed it no heed. I left the client after that game, assuming they never saved in the first place, and was going to remake them later. When I got back on to do so, I noticed they had saved properly, edited and saved again to be sure, then started another Rammus game. Still didn't show up. Is there some extra step I now have to do to save them on Legacy Client because of the new Client or is this caused by something else? How do I fix this?

replies.body: open the legacy client in admin mode?

I've run into this problem as well.   Looks like when you create a custom item set, it adds it to config/itemsets.json, but does NOT add it to config/champions/{champ}/recommended/

The solution that works for me is to create/modify the item set, then play a game with that champ _using the legacy client_.  It looks like the legacy client knows to read out itemsets.json into the recommended folder, but the new client does not.

Rito if you can fix this, that would great.  Or, you know, maybe just add item set creation/modification into the new client.  Thanks.
My problem is different, it just doesnt save them at all to my computer.

Were any manual modifications recently made to your config?  It sounds like your config may have bcome corrupt and not syncing properly.  I recommend resetting your config to help fix this up, but keep in mind you'll need to redo your bindings as a result:

 **Log into the game** then hop into **a custom game**. *Alt+Tab* out of the match, then navigate to your League installation folder, which should be in C:\Riot Games\League of Legends

Delete the folder named **Config**

Once you've deleted the folder, leave the custom match. You'll then want to hop into another custom match to confirm the changes were saved.

Make sure to delete the entirey of the folder for the reset.  Hope it helps!
This did not solve the issue. By chance could the issue be caused by having league saved on another drive? My C:\ drive is a solid state drive, so I put it on my E:\ drive.

It's possible that your config might not be saving if that specific file doesn't have permissions to write or scan data.  You've done a bit already, so hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so our tech team can work individually with you.  I recommend grabbing the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) for some logs to attach to that ticket.  We'll reply back asap.
I just remembered, I did do some manual modifications before. I copied my old config files from my previous computer and overwrote the ones that were previously there.

To be more specific about my problem, it seems no item set .json files are being saved/edited, and no new champion folders are being created under config\champions. Also after deleting the config folder the champions folder inside had not been remade by the game.
If I remember correctly, you have to save the item set for a certain champion and map. There should be an option that says do you want to save these item sets to a certain champion and or map.
